docs.text: slashOS is Linux done right. Discover a brand new, innovative Linux distribution, with exciting features and the user in mind.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Discover a brand new, innovative Linux distribution, with exciting features and the user in mind.
docs.title: slashOS is Linux done right.

docs.text: Terms of Service This page is W.I.P. so we do not promise accurate information. Prologue By accessing this web site or using our software, you are agreeing to be bound by these Terms of Service, all applicable laws and regulations, and agree that you are responsible for compliance with any applicable local laws. If you do not agree with any of these terms, you are prohibited from using or accessing this site and or our software. The materials contained in this web site are protected by applicable copyright and trademark law. These copyright statements, and trademarks can be found at the very end of this page. Limitations In no event shall the slashOS team or any affiliated party/individual be liable for any damages (including, without limitation, damages for loss of data or profit, or business interruption) caused by improper use of the software provided by the slashOS team, as stated by the GNU General Public License. Because some jurisdictions do not allow limitations on implied warranties, or limitations of liability for consequential or incidental damages, these limitations may not apply to you. The slashOS team may only assist with problems related to slashOS and related software ONLY. In no event shall the slashOS team be responsible for problems caused by derivative software to that of the slashOS team. Website Revisions Material appearing on this web site could include technical, typographical, or photographic errors. The slashOS team does not guarantee that any of the materials on this web site are accurate, complete, or current. The slashOS team may make changes to the materials contained on its web site at any time without notice, unless they are our Terms of Service or Privacy Policy. The slashOS team will not make any serious commitment to update such materials. External Links The slashOS team is not reviewing all of the sites linked to this website and is not responsible for the contents of any such site. The inclusion of any link does not mean endorsement, partnership or sponsorship by or to the slashOS team, unless otherwise stated. Use of any such linked website is at the user's own risk. Redistribution The user is free to redistribute, sell or put the slashOS .iso file(s) or source code on a third-party website without the permission of the owner provided that they abide by the GNU GPL 3.0 terms. (See "License" for more info) Derivative Software The user is free to create and redistribute (see "Redistribution" for more info) modified versions of the software provided by the slashOS team, provided that they abide with the GNU GPL 3.0 terms. (See "License" for more info) Contributing slashOS is an open-source project, meaning that it is free and you are absolutely encouraged to contribute to the project, fix bugs, or just see how it all works. Provided that you read Code of Conduct and Contributing Guidelines for AZOS GNU/Linux, RedKit and OpenLOB here. The Code of Conduct also contains instructions on how to report code of conduct violations. License slashOS is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This software is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this software. If not, see https://www.gnu.org/licenses/ .(Should be located in /etc/LICENSE) Privacy Policy This privacy policy applies to the slashOS operating system, related software and it's website. Data Collection We do not collect any personal information from our users, such as name, email address, phone number, or location etc. through our operating system, website or other software. Additional Notes Software shipped with slashOS or related software may collect telemetry or user data. In no way shall the slashOS team be held responsible or accountable for such data collection. Additionally, our website's hosting provider (GitHub Pages) may collect analytic data from users.
